meanings.definition: An inadequate blood supply to an organ or part of the body, especially the heart muscles.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that ischaemia in the heart can lead to serious health problems.
meanings.sent2: Ischaemia can cause damage to the heart muscles if not treated promptly.
meanings.sent3: When the heart realized it wasn't getting enough blood, it shouted, 'Ischaemia strikes again!'
meanings.sent4: The ischaemia creeping through the heart was like a thief stealing its vitality.
meanings.sent5: The image of the heart struggling with ischaemia stayed with me, a reminder of fragility.

meanings.definition: Local anemia due to mechanical obstruction of the blood supply.
meanings.sent1: The surgeon identified the ischaemia in the leg caused by a blocked artery.
meanings.sent2: When the blood flow is blocked, ischaemia can occur in a specific area of the body.
meanings.sent3: The leg, tired of the traffic jam in its blood vessels, complained about the ischaemia.
meanings.sent4: The ischaemia in the leg was like a dam holding back the river of blood.
meanings.sent5: The sensation of ischaemia in the leg was a stark warning of the body's vulnerability.
